SEARCH

Class Queen

java.lang.Object
Queen
public class Queen extends Object
The queen class is used to solve the 8 queens problem. The 8 queens problem is where 8 queens must be placed on a 8x8 chess board in such a way that the queens will not be threatening any of the other queens on the board.
Author:
Rachel Hussmann

  • Field Details

    • board

      public static String[][] board
      This 2d array variable holds the board that the queens will be placing themselves on. It is a 8x8 board that is initialized with "-" as black spaces. This variable is static as all instances of the queen class will need access to this variable.

    • numberOfQueens

      public static int numberOfQueens
      This static variable holds the total number of queens that have been created. 8 are needed to be able to successfully use the program.

  • Constructor Details

    • Queen

      public Queen(int x, int y)
      Constructor for the class Queen. Initializes the instance variables x and y given the parameters that it has been given. Then adds one to the static variable numberOfQueens to keep track of how many have been created. It then calls the method placeXs() to place "X"s where the queen could attack on the board.
      Parameters:
      x - The x (column) position the queen will have in the 2D array
      y - The y (row) position the queen will have in the 2D array
      See Also:
      • numberOfQueens
      • placeXs()

  • Method Details

    • checkPlacement

      public void checkPlacement()
      This method checks to see if the position given to the Queen object is safe. If it is safe, it places the queen ("Q") in her place and then calls the placeXs() method to place down where she could threaten other queens.
      See Also:
      • placeXs()

    • placeXs

      public void placeXs()
      This method places "X"s on the 2d array board in a horizontal, a vertical and diagonal lines where the queen could attack.
      See Also:
      • y
      • x
      • board

    • separateQueens

      public static void separateQueens(String queenPlacement)
      This method is used to take in a string of positions for the Queen objects. By using substrings the method is able to separate the different digits of the string, convert them to ints and then pass the number and its position to the Queen constructor. If the parameter string holds a string that has characters that hold no value, then an exception is thrown and the method tells the user that the value within the variable is not valid. After the whole string has been iterated through, the method calls printOutBoard() to print out the 2d array if the operation has been successful. The program then exits.
      Parameters:
      queenPlacement - user inputted string that contains 8 numbers which is used for the x and y position for each queen object.
      See Also:
      • printOutBoard()

    • printOutBoard

      public static void printOutBoard()
      This method first checks numberOfQueens to make sure that 8 queens have been created. If not the program exits.The method then iterates through the 2d array board to display where all the queens have been placed and where the queens have threatening positions("X").
      See Also:
      • board
      • numberOfQueens
